sub_title: Professor Criminal Law and Criminology of International Crimes University of Groningen.
summary:
Alette Smeulers (1967) is professor of Criminal Law and Criminology at the University of Groningen. Her research focuses on international crimes such as genocide, crimes against humanity and war crimes as well as terrorism. International crimes are manifestations of collective violence which can endanger international peace and security.  Knowledge on the origins and causes of  international crimes is necessary in order to be able to fight this type of criminality effectively and demands an inter- and multidisciplinary approach. Due to her inter- and multidisciplinary background, training and approach Alette Smeulers has acquired a unique expertise. In her research she focuses on the causes of these types of crimes, the perpetrators and the criminal prosecution thereof.

Alette is a passionate scholar and teacher. She is internationally known for her expertise on the criminology of international crimes and has published extensively in both legal journals as well as criminological journals.  She wrote and edited a number of books amongst which the volume 'Supranational Criminology – towards a criminology of international crimes' (Intersentia 2008) and the textbook entitled 'International Crimes and other gross human rights violations' (Martinus Nijhoff 2011). She initiated the new research line on criminology and international crimes at VU University and she initiated the master International Crimes and Criminology at VU University and was its first director. She has been teaching for many years now and has given classes such as international criminal law, international humanitarian law, international crimes, international criminology and perpetrators and bystanders. 

Keywords: international crimes, genocide, crimes against humanity, war crimes, causes of international crimes and other gross human rights violations, perpetrators and international criminal law.

treasury_media.title: Why do they kill? Research by Alette Smeulers
treasury_media.description: Mass atrocities such as the Holocaust during WWII; the genocide in Rwanda; but also the terrorist attacks in the New York, London, Madrid and Paris as well as the terrible crimes committed by ISIS in Syria and Iraq make us wonder who the perpetrators are.

education.field_of_study: Politieke wetenschappen - internationale betrekkingen en mensenrechten

awards.title: Tilburg Law School PhD Supervisor Award 2015
awards.description: The jury: 'She is an involved and compassionate supervisor who is supportive in such a way that it allowed her PhD students to believe in themselves. ... She is a true example and inspiration for her students in sharing her passion and enthusiasm for her research with others. As one of her supporters put it: 'I certainly try to instill in my students the same hunger for knowledge that she has conveyed to me.'
awards.issuer: PhD Council and Research and Management Support Office Tilburg Law School

publications.name: The selection of situations by the ICC: an mpirically based evaluation of te OTP's performance

profile_positions.description:
On september 1, 2016 I was appointed professor in criminal law and criminology at the University of Groningen and on May 1, 2018 also at the University College of Groningen. My main task is to teach the courses Introduction to Criminology, international crimes, terrorism, war and Criminal Law and Criminology. Next I conduct research in the field of international criminology and focus on international crimes such as genocide, crimes against humanity, war crimes and terrorism and I supervise PhD students.

See for more information on my research: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Kq9BujZuUqk 
And my personal website: http://alettesmeulers.org/index.php/en/
profile_positions.title: Pofessor in Criminal Law and Criminology of International Crimes at University of Groningen

profile_positions.description: At Smeulers training, research and consultancy I give lectures, training, workshops and  courses for professionals, policymakers, fellow academics, students, high-school students and everyone else who is interested. The content of the lecture can be adapted to the knowledge and expertise of the public. I usually take a multi- and interdisciplinary approach but on request can also take a purely legal or purely sociological approach. I am also available for research or consultancy. My areas of expertise are: international crimes and other gross human rights violations; genocide; crimes against humanity; war crimes; terrorism; international criminal law'international humanitarian law and perpetrators. See for an extensive list of topics my personal website: www.alettesmeulers.org.
profile_positions.title: Freelance

profile_positions.description: At the Faculty of Humanities within the program on Liberal Arts I teach the course War. In this course students study war from an interdisciplinary perspective. They use political science, international relations, international criminal and humanitarian law, sociology, criminology and psychology. Together with a colleague I will also be teaching the course Modernity, identity and evil for second year liberal arts students. We will discuss the three mentioned concepts from both a philosophical and a sociological perspective.
profile_positions.title: Lecturer (0.5 fte)

profile_positions.description: As a professor in international criminology I am responsible for the research related to international crimes such as genocide, crimes against humanity and war crimes. I teach a number of courses including International and European Criminal Law and International Criminology to the honours students. I furthermore supervise PhD students.
profile_positions.title: Professor in International Criminology at Tilburg University (0.2 fte)

profile_positions.description: As an invited professor I was responsible for teaching one course during the academicyear 2012-2013. The course was entitled international criminology. In the course students studied international crimes such as genocide, crimes against humanity and war crimes. They studied the causes of these crimes, the perpetrators thereof and the various means of post-conflict justice including international criminal courts and tribunals and truth and reconciliation commissions.
profile_positions.title: Professor at the University of Liége

profile_positions.description: I initiated and set up the inter- and multidisciplinary masterprogram International crimes and Criminology and was the first director of this program. It was a unique program with a clear thematic focus on international crimes. I have designed and developed new courses and was responsible fir getting the master accreditated and supervised the lecturers and was responsible for the overall quality of the program. I was teaching some courses myself such as the course International Crimes, Perpetrators & Bystanders and Research Seminars.
profile_positions.title: Director of the ICC master

profile_positions.description: I set up a new research line at VU University and established a research centre on international crimes. I regularly organized research meetings, expert-meetings, research seminars and brown bag lunches in order to stimulate academic debate and ensure that an inspiring research environment was created. The centre gained international recognition in a very short period of time.
profile_positions.title: Director ACIC

profile_positions.description:
Mijn promotieonderzoek betrof een rechtsvergelijkend onderzoek naar de uitlevering en mensenrechten in Nederlands, Duitsland en de Verenigde Staten. Verder deed ik onderzoek naar internationale misdrijven en gaf veel onderwijs. Vakken als: 

> international criminal law, 
> international humanitarian law, 
> Causes of Gross Human Rights Violations
>The Atrocity Triangle
profile_positions.title: Lecturer international criminal law
